attributes.action: No second referendum on the terms of Brexit
attributes.additional_details:
The people voted to Leave the EU on June 23 2016.
Holding another referendum on the final outcome of the Brexit negotiations would go against the will of the 17.4m people who voted to Leave the EU.
attributes.background: There should be no second referendum on the terms of Brexit. Article 50 has been triggered and it is now down to the Government to negotiate the terms of us leaving the EU. We believe that holding another  referendum goes against the will of the people.
